title: How quickly can you paraphrase a 700-word article? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you need to reword article fast but you have no idea how to do that, first of all, do not panic. Paraphrasing isn’t that hard if you know in what sequence it should be done. Being aware of the most effective paraphrasing strategies is your key to a well-written and successful article. If your text is 700-words long, the time spent on its rewording depends on how fast you type or write and whether you understand your topic clearly. For someone, it may take the whole day, others will need more time to finish paraphrasing the article.  If you’re having troubles with rewording your article, read the following guidelines below to fasten your writing process: Read the original abstract which you want to paraphrase once again, look at any unknown words until you fully understand their meaning and what the author meant in the passage that you’ve used.Hide the original text and try not to look at it, rewrite the author’s idea in your own words (imagine that you’re explaining it to your classmates or teacher).Now, compare your paraphrased text with the original source; while you’re comparing those two, think about whether you’ve accurately expressed the author’s ideas in a new manner if it’s unique to your writing style and whether you’ve simply changed the words in the author’s sentence or tried to replicate him.And the last but the most important one: put a citation with the author’s name, the year and the paragraph or page number that directly follows your paraphrase.

That’s the wrong question. Seven hundred clearly written words about a subject you know well may take an hour to paraphrase. Seven hundred words you have to think about the meaning of may take days. You can’t paraphrase without understanding.
